sub_title: Global IT Area Lead (Head of IT) Payments Channels & Merchant Services at ING Wholesale Bank
summary:
Driving change and innovation is my thing. Inspiring others and building bridges my second nature. IT Craftmanship and people are my passion. 

I am an experienced and passionate Senior IT Manager, who is highly valued for his strong people management skills, for his ability to build solid bridges between disciplines, like between Business and IT, for his knowledge of software development and architecture, as well as for his ability to drive change and transformation within an organization and within people.

I currently manage an IT Area with DevOps Teams that develop and maintain global online banking solutions for ING Wholesale Bank. 
As such I am responsible for building capability, professional development, work force planning, talent acquisition and staff management of ~120 highly professional and experienced Engineers in Amsterdam, Belgium, Germany, Poland, Bulgaria and also in India. 

Before that, within ING Domestic Bank, I used to manage the department that develops and maintains ING Core Bank software systems.

Before joining ING, I have worked for Capgemini for 14 years, of which the last 4 years in Australia, I was Practice Head Application Development & Integration , which made me responsible for professional development, strategy, forecasting and staff management of ~75 Project Managers, Business Analysts, System Analysts, Designers, Developers and Testers in Australia and ~25 in India.

In recognition of my expertises, I used to deliver both Agile and Project Management training to clients and colleagues at the Capgemini Academy in Utrecht the Netherlands, as well as the Capgemini University in Les Fontaines France and Hyderabad India. 
At ING I deliver training at the IT Academy in Agile SCRUM/Continuous Delivery. I am also a regular speaker at international IT conferences on the topics of Continuous Delivery, Agile and DevOps.

profile_positions.description:
Wilmar heads up the domain Global Digital Payments Channels & Merchant Services of ING Wholesale Bank.

This department develops ING Wholesale Bank's strategic Global Digital Payments Channels, offering corporate clients of ING worldwide access to their trades, payments, loans and accounts. The department also builds and maintains Point of Sales payment terminal systems and Cash Management applications. The department comprises 16 DevOps Teams:

- TS (Transactional Services)
In a distributed delivery model, with people working out of Amsterdam as well as India, this Team developes the Reporting modules of Inside Business Portal. They develop the front-end of the Internet version of Portal as well as the API's of both the Internet version and the Mobile version of Portal.

- Payments Portal
Working out of Amsterdam and India, these Teams develop the international Payments functionality of Portal, ING Wholesale Bank's strategic Global Payments Channel. They develop the front-end of the Internet version of Portal as well as the API's of both the Internet version and the Mobile version of Portal.

- Cards, cash and payment terminal services. 

- Bank User Portal
Working fully out of Amsterdam, this Team develops and maintains an assisted Channel for ING Service Desks, supporting ING clients worldwide with Payments-agreements.

- Inside Business Payments
These DevOps Teams develop ING Wholesale Bank's tactical Global Payments Channel for western and northern Europe. In a distributed delivery model the DevOps Teams work out of Amsterdam, Germany and Poland.

- ING Online
These DevOps Teams develop ING Wholesale Bank's tactical Global Payments Channel for eastern and central Europe. In a distributed delivery model the DevOps Teams work out of Amsterdam and Bulgaria.

- Open Banking

profile_positions.title: IT Manager

profile_positions.description:
Wilmar has worked for nearly 14 years with Capgemini.  In 2007 he moved from the Netherlands to Australia, where he became Practice Head Application Development & Integration for Capgemini, which made him responsible for building capability, professional development, strategy, forecasting, work force planning, talent acquisition and staff management of 75 Business Analysts, System Analysts, Designers, Developers, Testers and Project Managers in Australia and 25 in India. In spite of the part-time nature of this position, Wilmar achieved excellent results for the Practice,  amongst which a reduction in attrition from around 50% to less than 15%, increase of Utilisation from barely 65 to above 95% and an increase of mark-up from slightly below 2 to almost 2.2.

Next to his role as Practice Head, in Australia Wilmar had a part-time engagement at a client:


Australian Tax Office (Belastingdienst), Canberra

From October 2007 until February 2011, Wilmar was as independent assuror involved in a major system development and implementation program (Total budget more than $ 900,000,000) within the Australian Tax Office.

The role of Independent Assuror was to provide confidence that the program would meet its outcomes, and to ensure that the best practices, quality standards and governance guidelines were being applied within the technical and project areas, as well as in the organizational transition program.

Wilmar’s role was to manage the Capgemini project team who were monitoring the design, build, test and business deployment phases. Wilmar’s team comprised experienced project managers, solution architects and subject matter experts on organizational transition and change management.
In this role Wilmar engaged with many senior executives within the ATO and within the Australian Ministry of Finance, like the Commissioner, the Second Commissioner and occasionally also the Treasurer.
